results.abstract: Financial information market, a $6.5 billion business, has reached crossroads; emergence of Internet as vast information pipeline calls into question future of companies that feed data to desktop boxes over closed, proprietary networks; Reuters, Telerate and Bloomberg, three major financial data companies, are racing to develop array of services--stock quotes, analytical tools, news reports--that are flexible enough to be delivered to customer's PC in any number of combinations; photo; chart (M)
results.snippet: THE battle for Wall Street's desktops has always been fierce. Now the jostling among the major competitors has become so intense that it is hard to tell who's winning. The short answer: no one.    Michael R. Bloomberg, the brash former stock trader...
results.lead_paragraph: THE battle for Wall Street's desktops has always been fierce. Now the jostling among the major competitors has become so intense that it is hard to tell who's winning. The short answer: no one. Michael R. Bloomberg, the brash former stock trader who started Bloomberg L.P. in 1981 and turned it into the industry's hottest financial-data company, seems on top of the world. People familiar with Mr. Bloomberg said that 18 months ago, he even approached Dow Jones & Company, the venerable publisher of The Wall Street Journal, about a merger.

results.abstract: Thomas M Caruso Sr letter discusses Dec 22 article on railroads and their impact on Westchester County (M)

headline.main: Railroads Should Play Bigger Role in Future

results.snippet: Your article $(''County's Rails Tell of Past and Future,'' Dec. 22$) told of some of the past, but to my dismay, incorporated little about the future. While it was enjoyable, it did not make any reference to the inequalities in public policy that...
results.lead_paragraph: Your article $(''County's Rails Tell of Past and Future,'' Dec. 22$) told of some of the past, but to my dismay, incorporated little about the future. While it was enjoyable, it did not make any reference to the inequalities in public policy that almost brought the railroads to extinction. I work for the New York State Thruway Authority as an emergency responder on the Tappan Zee Bridge. Every day I see the rat race Americans call commuting. High Occupancy Vehicle lanes lie idle as one-driver cars cram into long lines at EZ Pass and cash toll booths. Impatience, excessive speed and lack of driver attentiveness result in 90 percent of all incidents on the span. Politicians focus their attention on ameliorating conditions by exercising cosmetic changes. The flanged wheel riding atop a steel rail is still the most efficient form of ground transportation.

results.abstract: Roundup of upcoming entertainment events in SoHo and Gramercy Park sections of Manhattan and Fort Greene section of Brooklyn, NY; photos (M)
results.snippet: SOHO   The Title's the Thing (Or at Least the Main Prop)       An improvisational opera company, Play It by Ear takes audience suggestions and instantly creates music, lyrics and drama. The main prop is often the show's title, and the current...
results.lead_paragraph: SOHO The Title's the Thing (Or at Least the Main Prop) An improvisational opera company, Play It by Ear takes audience suggestions and instantly creates music, lyrics and drama. The main prop is often the show's title, and the current production is ''3 Paper Cups.''

results.abstract: First of two articles, A New Universe, focuses on recent discovery of first extrasolar planets by astronomers in US and abroad; discoveries have led scientists to proclaim new golden age of astronomy and has renewed enthusiasm in search for extraterrestrial life; discoveries by Drs Geoffrey W Marcy and R Paul Butler of San Francisco State University, and other teams in US and Switzerland, discussed; at least eight planet-sized objects, and possibly two more, have been detected orbiting other stars like Sun; diagrams; map (L)

headline.main: In a Golden Age of Discovery, Faraway Worlds Beckon

results.snippet: Standing outside the dome of Lick Observatory on this lofty summit, two astronomers gazed beyond the foothills to the far horizon where California meets the Pacific Ocean. As the solid world at their feet rotated east, the great red sphere of glowing...
results.lead_paragraph: Standing outside the dome of Lick Observatory on this lofty summit, two astronomers gazed beyond the foothills to the far horizon where California meets the Pacific Ocean. As the solid world at their feet rotated east, the great red sphere of glowing hydrogen seemed to sink perilously close to a doomsday collision, only to slip harmlessly out of sight in the west. At the moment of sunset, birds somewhere in the trees broke into song, life sounding retreat at the loss of light. The astronomers turned back to the dome and the telescope within. Time to go to work, time to search the heavens for other stars not unlike the Sun and see whether some of them also have companion worlds -- other places where night follows day, where there might be air and water, mountains and shore, even life and song.

results.abstract: Russian space agency launches team of astronauts into space to take command of Russian Mir space station, bringing along German astronaut for three-week visit; Germany will pay millions of dollars to struggling Russian space industry to have their astronaut on board (M)
results.snippet: The financially troubled Russian space agency launched a team of astronauts into space today to take command of the Russian Mir space station, bringing along a German astronaut for a three-week visit.     The three astronauts blasted off from the...
results.lead_paragraph: The financially troubled Russian space agency launched a team of astronauts into space today to take command of the Russian Mir space station, bringing along a German astronaut for a three-week visit. The three astronauts blasted off from the Baikonur space center in Kazakhstan at 5:09 P.M., space officials said. ''The launching at Baikonur was without any problems,'' said Valery Lyndin, a spokesman at mission control outside Moscow.

results.snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-9    Vengeful Ex-Yeltsin Aide Is Elected to Parliament  Aleksandr V. Korzhakov, once the bodyguard but now an antagonist of President Boris N. Yeltsin, was elected to represent the industrial zone of Tula in the Russian...
results.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-9 Vengeful Ex-Yeltsin Aide Is Elected to Parliament Aleksandr V. Korzhakov, once the bodyguard but now an antagonist of President Boris N. Yeltsin, was elected to represent the industrial zone of Tula in the Russian Parliament. The position will give Mr. Korzhakov, whom Mr. Yeltsin dismissed for slander in June, immunity from prosecution for corruption, of which he has been regularly accused. A5

results.abstract: National Aeronautics and Space Admininstration launches space shuttle Discovery, with seven astronauts aboard, for 10-day mission to update and tune up Hubble Space Telescope; diagrams (M)
results.snippet: Astronauts aboard the space shuttle Discovery soared into space today on their way to the Hubble Space Telescope, where they plan to replace two aging scientific instruments with more advanced ones, tune up guidance systems and generally make...
results.lead_paragraph: Astronauts aboard the space shuttle Discovery soared into space today on their way to the Hubble Space Telescope, where they plan to replace two aging scientific instruments with more advanced ones, tune up guidance systems and generally make everything shipshape for many more years of cosmic exploration. The launching of the scheduled 10-day mission took place on time shortly before 4 A.M., the fiery exhaust of the Discovery's rockets turning night into day for a few thunderous moments.

results.abstract: Second article in series Waiting For China: Straddling Two Worlds notes that 110,000 Hong Kong Chinese have come to Vancouver, British Columbia, over last decade to escape uncertainty in Hong Kong; many are rich men who are referred to as 'astronauts' because they rocket back and forth to Hong Kong, where they still run businesses; even though they are rarely in Vancouver, most 'astronauts' and their wives have managed to become Canadian citizens; their passports are prized insurance policies that allow them to straddle both worlds; they can return to Hong Kong in waning days of British rule, but can get out again if need be after China takes over on July 1; graph; photo (M)

headline.main: For Many From Hong Kong, Vancouver Is a Way Station

results.snippet: On Thursday nights in downtown Vancouver, the back room at the Victoria restaurant fills with Chinese women who have come to play mah-jongg, feast on delicacies like marinated jellyfish and show off jewels, cell phones and other gifts from their...
results.lead_paragraph: On Thursday nights in downtown Vancouver, the back room at the Victoria restaurant fills with Chinese women who have come to play mah-jongg, feast on delicacies like marinated jellyfish and show off jewels, cell phones and other gifts from their husbands, who are all back in Hong Kong. The maitre d'hotel welcomes them warmly, knowing they will order the rarest dishes and leave a big tip. ''They are astronauts' wives,'' he says. They are called that because their rich husbands rocket back and forth to Hong Kong, where they still run businesses.

results.snippet: ALAN Goodman has worked on enough successful children's television shows (''Clarissa Explains It All'' and ''Hey Dude,'' to name a couple) to know that it pays to listen to young folks. Several years ago, he was trying to come up with an idea for a...
results.lead_paragraph: ALAN Goodman has worked on enough successful children's television shows (''Clarissa Explains It All'' and ''Hey Dude,'' to name a couple) to know that it pays to listen to young folks. Several years ago, he was trying to come up with an idea for a new show when he happened to talk to his 10-year-old nephew on the phone. The nephew mentioned that he was reading the Hardy Boys, and something clicked in his uncle's head. He recalled that as a youngster he had read every single Hardy Boys book in the school library. He then made a quick trip to a bookstore, where he found that the books were still enormously popular. ''Kids love mysteries,'' he said.

results.abstract: Sen John Glenn of Ohio is expected not to seek re-election despite pleas of Democratic leaders, who fear Gov George V Voinovich, Republican, will win seat (M)

headline.main: Senator Glenn Is Expected To Step Down

results.snippet: Senator John Glenn, the Ohio Democrat and former astronaut who was the first American to orbit Earth, is expected to announce on Thursday that he will not seek re-election to a fifth term next year.    Mr. Glenn's announcement is to coincide with the...
results.lead_paragraph: Senator John Glenn, the Ohio Democrat and former astronaut who was the first American to orbit Earth, is expected to announce on Thursday that he will not seek re-election to a fifth term next year. Mr. Glenn's announcement is to coincide with the 35th anniversary of his flight into space.

results.abstract: Letter from NOW Legal Defense and Education Fund aide Patricia Blau Reuss on Maureen Dowd's Feb 16 article on Pamela Harriman (S)

headline.main: Mrs. Harriman Broke Down the Barriers to Women in Politics

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: NOW LEGAL DEFENSE AND EDUCATION FUND

results.snippet: To the Editor:    Maureen Dowd's dismissal of Pamela Harriman's role in politics, and especially the women's movement, is unfair (column, Feb. 16). Mrs. Harriman was as important a symbol of women's unique accomplishments as was the astronaut Sally...
results.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Maureen Dowd's dismissal of Pamela Harriman's role in politics, and especially the women's movement, is unfair (column, Feb. 16). Mrs. Harriman was as important a symbol of women's unique accomplishments as was the astronaut Sally Ride. Both were unconventional, competed openly with men and survived. They not only succeeded but told decades of girls and women that nothing was impossible.

results.abstract: The future is growing old all over Walter Disney Co's 'magic kingdom' as the company responds to America's growing disenchantment with the allures of a high-tech future; from the film lot to the amusement park to the real-life town that the company calls Celebration, Disney has largely given up on imagining a new future; Tomorrowland at Walt Disney World has been renovated in a retro style recalling classic science fiction; Celebration, a community-to-be of 20,000 residents, is modeled after a turn-of-the century town; and even in films, Disney has recognized the greater appeal of yesterday's idea of the future; photos (M)

headline.main: Once Visionary, Disney Calls Future a Thing of the Past

results.snippet: There is a place here where the future looks old. It is called Tomorrowland, and it is part of Walt Disney World, the most popular tourist destination on Earth.    When the Walt Disney Company decided to give Tomorrowland a makeover in 1995, it went...
results.lead_paragraph: There is a place here where the future looks old. It is called Tomorrowland, and it is part of Walt Disney World, the most popular tourist destination on Earth. When the Walt Disney Company decided to give Tomorrowland a makeover in 1995, it went retro.
